intro: Entandrophragma tomentosum, commonly known as the African teak, is a tropical hardwood tree native to western and central Africa. It is characterized by its dense, heavy wood with a fine, even texture and a pale to golden-brown color. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and has a straight trunk with a buttressed base. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a hairy underside, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in panicles. The plant is valued for its durable, high-quality timber used in furniture and construction.
